item.dc:creator: xalener
item.description:
acade365:

I know I’m late, but you are wrong on a couple accounts. Miramax wasn’t the company that produced nor published LOTR. They originally were supposed to be, but then backed out and New Line Cinema took charge.

Also, it isn’t owned by Disney anymore (it was sold in 2010).

Yeah, I fucked up a long time ago. Also, my point still stands.

item.description:
Pyro:

Not quite. According to Wikipedia, Lucas wrote A New Hope and co-wrote Return of the Jedi.

I’m pretty sure they meant directed, since the exclusion of Empire Strikes Back implies the fact that Irvin Kershner directed that movie, but George still wrote it.

item.dc:creator: Llewen_Ebag
item.description:
Pyro:

Not quite. According to Wikipedia, Lucas wrote A New Hope and co-wrote Return of the Jedi.

Then what happened?

At first the prequels were okay with me, but I was about 7 when they rolled along. Rewatching them makes me cringe so hard you all have probably heard me by now. I think VGcats said it best “My love for you is like a lovely river of loving, love”.

Read full topic
item.source: Disney now owns Star Wars and other Lucasarts-related stuff.

item.title: Disney now owns Star Wars and other Lucasarts-related stuff.
item.dc:creator: papernick
item.description:
xalener:

That’s fucking dumb.
Plus, you know what else Disney has pretty much owned forever? Mirimax. The company that brought you LOTR and such. You know what MIRIMAX owns? Dimension films. The company that brought you PULP FUCKING FICTION.

Pulp Fiction is a Disney movie. Buck the fuck up.

I know I’m late, but you are wrong on a couple accounts. Miramax wasn’t the company that produced nor published LOTR. They originally were supposed to be, but then backed out and New Line Cinema took charge.

Also, it isn’t owned by Disney anymore (it was sold in 2010).

Read full topic

item.title: Disney now owns Star Wars and other Lucasarts-related stuff.
item.dc:creator: Llewen_Ebag
item.description:
xalener:

That’s fucking dumb.

You people act like this is the first time anything like this happened. Remember when Disney bought Marvel shortly before producing what has been the most consistently well produced super hero films in the past three decades? Say what you will about “hurr durr generic action” or what the fuck ever, they made an impact. Plus, you know what else Disney has pretty much owned forever? Mirimax. The company that brought you LOTR and such. You know what MIRIMAX owns? Dimension films. The company that brought you PULP FUCKING FICTION.

Pulp Fiction is a Disney movie. Buck the fuck up.

I agree completely. I fucking love Pulp Fiction by the way.

For those of you who don’t know, the original trilogy wasn’t written by George Lucas, only directed IIRC. What Lucas did was put together some designs a friend of his made (which were awesome beyond belief). Other guy wrote the story. It was far more a team effort and Lucas being put at the helm directing everything. By the prequels, he took on writing and you see how it turned out. So this is for the better, since Disney would rather become a porn distributor before they waste the millions spent on Star Wars. So a good writer is pretty much needed.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: Maxx_Skywalker
item.description:
Lemonz&oranges:

episode 7’s plot is already spoiled:
https://starwars.wikia.com/wiki/New_Republic_era

wouldnt be surprised if Yuuzhan Vong appeared in the trilogy

I would love it if they were. I freaking loved the New Jedi Order books. Plus, Kyle Katarn makes an appearance. Good thing the Extended Universe is considered canon.

Read full topic
item.source: Disney now owns Star Wars and other Lucasarts-related stuff.

item.title: Disney now owns Star Wars and other Lucasarts-related stuff.
item.dc:creator: Orpheon
item.description:
I hope they don’t do anything with any other superweapons, or any of the reborn Emperors or anything. That stuff is just crazy, and basically negates everything that happened in the OT. I’d rather they just do something completely new. Forget the Empire, just do something different. Yuuzhan Vong or whatever, just something other than the Empire and the Republic and yadayada. That’s all we’ve gotten from Star Wars since A New Hope was released, basically. Well, in visual media anyway. I know there’s plenty of books and junk and stuff, but I swore off that stuff when I realized even the best SW writers feel compelled to make up dumb words for common stuff. It’s at least as offensive as in the 50’s when everything had ‘space’ affixed to it, if not more so.

Seriously though, if Lucas originally intended a nine-movie epic, what did he intend VII, VIII, and IX to be about? It seems to me like he scrapped that idea, otherwise he should have shot those instead of the prequels, and then made the prequels later with new actors like he did anyway, that way the sequels wouldn’t have to have new actors as well. RotJ didn’t even seem to be at all open for a sequel anyway.

Read full topic

even moreso if they show the Vong terraformation of Coruscant (iirc the Vongs re-terraformed Coruscant to act as a new home planet; but ultimatly because of ther technophobia)

item.title: Disney now owns Star Wars and other Lucasarts-related stuff.
item.dc:creator: Lemonz_amp_amp_orang
item.description:
maybe episode 7 will showcase the Shawken device

for those who dont know what the Skawken device is some theoretical superweapon designed to create a artificial “big bang”

it would destroy the planet Shawken, sending the fragments into hyperspace, in which said fragments will crash into other planets causing a chain reaction of planet destruction, which would eventually destroy all matter in the universe

It could appear in the new movie assuming it is set RIGHT after return of the jedi

moar here:
https://starwars.wikia.com/wiki/Shawken_Device

item.title: Disney now owns Star Wars and other Lucasarts-related stuff.
item.dc:creator: danielsangeo
item.description:
Well, if they’re going to pick up right where they left off, Luke and company have a day’s rest on Endor and before Vader’s body is even cold, they’re called to go help a planet far in the outer-rim – an Imperial-run planet – ward off invaders that look like dinosaurs.

Hm…

[COLOR=’#151515’]Okay, yes, I’ve only read two EU books so far: Truce at Bakura and Rebel Dawn. I can’t comment on EU beyond that.
